company.name: ALDI INC.
company.business_description: ALDI INC. operates as a retail grocery company. In the ordinary course of its business, the company uses information in consumer reports obtained from consumer reporting agencies in the consideration, acceptance, and denial of applicants for employment.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681m(a), and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: ALDI Inc. used consumer reports from consumer reporting agencies to evaluate employment applicants. When the company denied applications or rescinded employment offers based in whole or in part on information from these consumer reports, it failed to notify the affected consumers that the consumer report contributed to the adverse action and failed to provide the name and address of the consumer reporting agency that supplied the information, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

counts.title: Violation of FCRA Section 615(a)
counts.representation: Respondent denied applications or rescinded employment offers based on consumer report information
counts.fact: Respondent failed to advise consumers that the consumer report information contributed to the adverse action and failed to provide the name and address of the consumer reporting agency that supplied the information
counts.conclusion: Respondent has violated the provisions of Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681m(a).

counts.title: Unfair and Deceptive Acts or Practices
counts.representation: By failing to comply with Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act
counts.fact: Respondent engaged in acts or practices that violated mandatory disclosure requirements under FCRA
counts.conclusion: Respondent has engaged in unfair and deceptive acts or practices in or affecting commerce in violation of Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act.

definitions.consumer: As defined in Section 603(c) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681a(c).
definitions.consumer report: As defined in Section 603(d) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681a(d).
definitions.consumer reporting agency: As defined in Section 603(f) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681a(f).

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Failing to Provide Adverse Action Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must cease and desist from failing to disclose to employment applicants when adverse action is taken based on a consumer report, and must send remedial notices to past applicants denied employment.

requirements.description: Must disclose to applicant when employment is denied based on consumer report information, including that adverse action was based on the report and the name and address of the consumer reporting agency
requirements.quoted_text: Failing, whenever employment is denied either wholly or partly because of information contained in a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency to disclose to the applicant for employment at the time such adverse action is communicated to the applicant (a) that the adverse action was based wholly or partly on information contained in such a report and (b) the name and address of the consumer reporting agency making the report.

requirements.description: Must mail two copies of the required letter to each applicant denied employment between January 1, 1994 and the order issuance date based on consumer report information
requirements.quoted_text: Failing, within ninety (90) days after the date of service of this Order, to mail two (2) copies of the letter attached hereto as Appendix A, completed to provide the name and address of the consumer reporting agency supplying the report to each applicant who was denied employment by Aldi Inc. between January 1, 1994, and the date this Order is issued, based in whole or in part on information contained in a consumer report from a consumer reporting agency, such copies of the letter to be sent first class mail to the last known address of the applicant that is reflected in respondent's files, and accompanied by a copy of the Federal Trade Commission brochure attached hereto as Appendix B, copies of which are to be provided by respondent.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years documents demonstrating compliance with Part I, including employment evaluation criteria, employee instructions, notices to applicants, and records of applicants for whom consumer reports were obtained and employment offers were not made.

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to FTC documents demonstrating compliance with Part I for five years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent and its successors and assigns shall, for five (5) years from the date of issuance of this Order, maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, documents demonstrating compliance with the requirements of Part I of this Order, such documents to include, but not be limited to, all employment evaluation criteria relating to consumer reports, instructions given to employees regarding compliance with the provisions of this Order, all notices or a written or electronically stored notation of the description of the form of notice and date such notice was provided to applicants pursuant to any provisions of this Order, and records of all applicants for whom consumer reports were obtained for whom offers of employment are not made or have been withheld, withdrawn, or rescinded based, in whole or in part, on information contained in a consumer report.

provisions.title: Distribution of Order to Responsible Personnel
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order at least once per year for five years to all persons responsible for compliance with Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

requirements.description: Deliver a copy of the Order at least once per year to all persons responsible for compliance with Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent and its successors and assigns shall, for five (5) years from the date of issuance of this Order, deliver a copy of this Order at least once per year to all persons responsible for the respondent's compliance with Section 615(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

provisions.title: Notice of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least thirty days prior to any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or change in name or address.

requirements.description: Notify FTC at least thirty days prior to any proposed corporate change that may affect compliance obligations
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent and its successors and assigns shall notify the Federal Trade Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any proposed change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including, but not limited to a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within sixty days of service of the Order and at other times as required by the Commission.

requirements.description: File written compliance report with the Commission setting forth in detail the manner and form of compliance with the Order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent and its successors and assigns shall, within sixty (60) days of the date of service of this Order, and at such other times as the Federal Trade Commission may require, file with the Commission a report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which it has complied with this Order.

provisions.title: Order Termination
provisions.summary: This Order will terminate on September 5, 2017, or twenty years from the most recent date the United States or FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on September 5, 2017, or twenty years from the most recent complaint filing date, whichever is later
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order will terminate on September 5, 2017, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Federal Trade Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. Any paragraph in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. This Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. This Order if such complaint is filed after the Order has terminated pursuant to this paragraph.

duration.termination_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order will terminate on September 5, 2017, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Federal Trade Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later
